intro: Canarium latistipulatum subsp. mitus, commonly known as the broad-leaved candlenut, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruits are woody, three-lobed capsules that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine. The subspecies mitus is distinguished by its broader leaf tips compared to other subspecies of Canarium latistipulatum.
